wikipedia_page.main: Charles Dickinson West (January 1847 – 10 January 1908) was an Irish mechanical engineer and naval architect, who worked for many years at the Imperial College of Engineering, in Meiji era Japan.

response: File:Charies Dickinson West0097.JPG|Charles Dickinson West, mechanical engineer

The 'foreign expert' group was, likewise, a roster of the famous: Dr. James Curtis Hepburn; Josiah Conder;  John Milne, Edward Divers, James Main Dixon and Charles Dickinson West, all of the Imperial College of Engineering; Henry Faulds of the Tsukiji Hospital; Robert Maclagan of the Osaka Mint; Basil Hall Chamberlain; and  William George Aston and  Ernest Mason Satow.

*No. 100: Educational Equipment for Mechanical Engineering of Imperial College of Engineering/Related Documents of C.D. West. The dawn of modern engineering in Japan is coincidently the same period of textbooks published in Western Europe.  in Tokyo is believed the first university worldwide bearing the name engineering and succeeded by Tokyo Imperial University (東京帝國大學, Tōkyō teikoku daigaku). A Number of Technical drawing, tool, Mechanism, model, lecture note and educational material used by Charles Dickinson West, Henry Dyer and others are preserved and displayed. - Tokyo
His son Charles Dickinson West became an engineer and naval architect.
